headline: Crocs, Axon, Carvana see gains on Q1 earnings beats
summary: Used car platform Carvana (CVNA) gets a stock boost after beating first quarter earnings estimates. Body armor manufacturer Axon Enterprise (AXON) also topped expectations on its top and bottom lines. Lastly, footwear brand Crocs (CROX) pulls its guidance while also outperforming quarterly forecasts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Taser Maker Axon Enterprise Stock Soars To Lead S&P 500, Nasdaq
summary: Axon Enterprise shares surged to lead S&P 500 and Nasdaq gainers Thursday, a day after the Taser maker topped profit and sales forecasts and lifted its outlook on demand for its new artificial intelligence policing tool.

headline: Axon Enterprise (NasdaqGS:AXON) Increases 2025 Revenue Guidance Despite Lower Q1 Net Income
summary: Axon Enterprise (NasdaqGS:AXON) recently raised its full-year 2025 earnings guidance, reflecting strong growth expectations with a revised revenue range of $2.6 to $2.7 billion. Despite this optimistic outlook, the company's first-quarter earnings revealed a drop in net income and earnings per share compared to the previous year, albeit with considerable revenue growth. While the market as a whole has experienced a general upward trend due to favorable trade news and advancements in...

headline: Axon's Q1 Earnings Top Estimates on Solid Software & Services Sales
summary: AXON's first-quarter revenues increase 31.3% year over year, driven by the impressive performance of its Connected Devices and Software & Services segments.

headline: Why Axon Enterprise Stock Is Charging Higher Today
summary: Axon beat top- and bottom-line estimates, posting 25%-plus revenue growth for the 13th consecutive quarter.  Axon is a highly valued stock, but the results keep justifying investor enthusiasm.  Law enforcement vendor Axon Enterprise (NASDAQ: AXON) posted strong year-over-year growth in the first quarter and raised its guidance for the year.

headline: Axon Hits the Mark to Start 2025
summary: Axon Enterprise saw healthy gains in both revenue and earnings, with particularly noteworthy gains in the software and services segment.  Axon raised its full-year revenue guidance by $50 million to a new range of $2.6 billion to $2.7 billion and generally sees healthy momentum continuing.  Axon got good results in the first quarter of 2025, setting a new record for quarterly revenue and seeing year-over-year sales growth top 25% for the 13th quarter in a row.

headline: Axon Jumps On Earnings, Despite DOGE, Tariffs; New Taser Dart Coming
summary: Axon Enterprise is among the biggest S&P 500 gainers early Thursday after comfortably beating first-quarter earnings estimates and raising its full-year outlook.  International sales and demand for its Draft One AI tool are helping power growth, even as new federal government contract activity is in limbo amid DOGE-led budget cutting.  CEO Rick Smith also highlighted the next-generation Apollo Dart for its Taser 10 weapon "that really gives us a shot at displacing lethal force."
